meanings.sent1: I will prepack my suitcase before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The company will prepack the products for faster shipping.
meanings.sent3: She decided to prepack her lunch to save time in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The team will prepack the essentials for the camping trip.
meanings.sent5: Remember to prepack your bag with all the necessary items.

meanings.definition: To package in advance for sale
meanings.sent1: The bakery will prepack the cookies for the bake sale.
meanings.sent2: They prepack the snacks to make shopping easier for customers.
meanings.sent3: He likes to prepack the gift baskets with care.
meanings.sent4: The store will prepack the fruits for convenience.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to prepack the items neatly for display.

meanings.definition: A package that has been prepared in advance
meanings.sent1: She bought a prepack of stationery for school.
meanings.sent2: The prepack of spices made cooking dinner quick.
meanings.sent3: The prepack of snacks was a lifesaver during the road trip.
meanings.sent4: He grabbed a prepack of batteries for his flashlight.
meanings.sent5: The prepack of bandages came in handy during the hike.
